title: Bug 120922: Improve 'Dirty Page' behavior in XML Report Designer editor
description:
When editing XML in the 'source' view of the Layout Editor and then attempting to switch back to the Layout view, an error message is displayed, indicating that changes need to be saved. The user is then prompted with the options to save, discard, or cancel the changes.

Currently, the error message is not clear and is titled 'Error'. Furthermore, the user is required to figure out how to save or discard the changes, which can be difficult.

The error message should clearly state that the 'Source page is dirty', and provide instructions on how to save or discard the changes.
OB: When editing XML in the 'source' view of the Layout Editor and attempting to switch back to the Layout view, an error message is displayed with the title 'Error'.
EB: When editing XML in the 'source' view of the Layout Editor and attempting to switch back to the Layout view, an error message should be displayed with the title 'Error: Source page is dirty'.
SR:
1. Open the XML Report Designer and switch to the 'source' view
2. Make some changes to the XML
3. Attempt to switch back to the Layout view
4. Verify that an error message is displayed with the title 'Error: Source page is dirty'
